conditions: When accused dishonestly induces victim to hand over money or property using false pretences
exceptions: Does not apply when transaction is purely civil in nature with no fraudulent intent

conditions: Primary section for cheating involving delivery of property or alteration of documents
exceptions: Does not apply to breach of civil contract without dishonest intent

conditions: When online or offline fraud involves inducing victim to part with money
exceptions: Does not apply when victim voluntarily gave money knowing risks

conditions: Core section whenever cheating results in delivery of property or money loss
exceptions: Does not apply to failed promises that are merely civil in nature

conditions: When cheating involved use of forged documents to deceive
exceptions: Only applies if forgery element is separately proved

conditions: When forgery was committed specifically for purpose of cheating victim
exceptions: Both forgery and cheating must be established

conditions: Primary section when property was entrusted and misappropriated
exceptions: Does not apply where no trust relationship exists between parties

conditions: When breach involves public servant or banker or merchant in official capacity
exceptions: Applies only to persons in specific fiduciary roles

conditions: Definition section that establishes what constitutes criminal breach of trust
exceptions: Background section; not charged standalone

conditions: Primary section whenever movable property is taken dishonestly without consent
exceptions: Does not apply when taking was under bona fide claim of right

conditions: Punishment section that always accompanies Section 378 charge
exceptions: Applies alongside 378 always

conditions: Core section for all theft scenarios involving movable property
exceptions: Does not apply to property disputes where ownership itself is disputed

conditions: Punishment always charged with 378 in theft cases
exceptions: Applies alongside 378 always

conditions: Applies specifically to vehicle theft using criminal force
exceptions: Only for theft of vehicles with force element

conditions: When stolen property is found with another person who received it knowing it was stolen
exceptions: Requires knowledge of property being stolen

conditions: When stolen property found with a receiver or fence
exceptions: Applies when receiver had knowledge of theft

conditions: When accused made gesture or preparation with intention to cause apprehension of force
exceptions: No actual physical contact needed; apprehension of force sufficient

conditions: When criminal force used without grave provocation
exceptions: Grave and sudden provocation may reduce charge

conditions: When voluntary hurt is caused to victim
exceptions: Applies only when hurt is voluntarily inflicted

conditions: When grievous hurt is caused; serious injuries
exceptions: Only for grievous hurt as defined in IPC 320

conditions: When acid or corrosive substance is thrown causing grievous hurt
exceptions: Specific to acid attack situations only

conditions: When assault on woman is intended to outrage her modesty
exceptions: Only applicable when victim is woman and modesty element present

conditions: Primary IPC section for cruelty by husband or relatives in domestic setting
exceptions: Does not apply to domestic violence by persons outside husband/relatives

conditions: When domestic violence results in death within 7 years of marriage and dowry connected
exceptions: Applies only when death occurs under specific dowry-connected circumstances

conditions: When victim of domestic violence is driven to commit suicide
exceptions: Requires proof that accused abetted suicide

conditions: When domestic violence involves sexual assault or outrage of modesty
exceptions: Applies when sexual aspect of violence present

conditions: When threats form part of domestic abuse pattern
exceptions: Applies when threats to life or serious injury made

conditions: Primary section specifically targeting cruelty by husband and in-laws
exceptions: Does not apply against wife or her relatives

conditions: When cruelty leads to bride's unnatural death connected to dowry demands
exceptions: Specific to dowry-related deaths within 7 years of marriage

conditions: When persistent cruelty abets suicide of woman
exceptions: Need to establish abetment and mens rea

conditions: Transfer of Property Act provisions govern landlord-tenant relations
exceptions: State-specific Rent Control Acts may override general TPA provisions

conditions: When tenant criminally misappropriates security deposit or property entrusted
exceptions: Only when there is clear entrustment and criminal intent in misappropriation

conditions: When either landlord or tenant commits criminal trespass
exceptions: Applies when one party enters property without right to do so

conditions: When tenant causes damage to rented premises
exceptions: Requires proof of intentional or negligent damage to property

conditions: Transfer of Property Act governs rights and disputes over immovable property
exceptions: Does not apply to movable property disputes

conditions: When property dispute involves forged title deeds or sale deeds
exceptions: Applicable only when fraudulent documents are primary cause of dispute

conditions: When forged property documents of high value are involved
exceptions: Specific to forgery of valuable security deeds wills

conditions: When forged property documents are used to claim or transfer title
exceptions: Both forgery and use must be established

conditions: When property transfer was induced by fraud or misrepresentation
exceptions: Requires dishonest inducement to hand over property

conditions: When party forcibly enters property they have no right to enter
exceptions: Requires entry into property without consent or right

conditions: When employer wrongfully confines employee preventing them from leaving
exceptions: Unusual situation; applies only to physical confinement

conditions: When employer uses threats during termination or service period
exceptions: Applies only when threats to harm are made in employment context

conditions: Primary section whenever false evidence is given on oath in proceedings
exceptions: Requires evidence to be given on oath in legal proceedings

conditions: When false evidence is fabricated rather than given orally
exceptions: Applies to creating fake documents or records

conditions: Punishment section that is always charged along with 191 or 192
exceptions: Always paired with the substantive section

conditions: When false certificate is issued by authority
exceptions: Applies only to persons authorised to issue certificates

conditions: When false certificate is used knowing it to be false
exceptions: Requires knowledge of falsity at time of use

conditions: Primary section defining defamation; applies to all false statements harming reputation
exceptions: Does not apply to true statements made in public interest

conditions: Punishment section always charged alongside 499
exceptions: Always accompanies Section 499

conditions: When defamatory content was printed or engraved for distribution
exceptions: Specific to print media newspapers or published materials

conditions: When printed defamatory material was sold or offered for sale
exceptions: Requires commercial distribution element

conditions: Core section for all defamation cases including social media
exceptions: Truth and public good are complete defences

conditions: Punishment section paired with 499 in criminal defamation
exceptions: Always accompanies 499

conditions: When defamatory statements cause public mischief or communal disharmony
exceptions: Applies when statement affects public at large beyond individual

conditions: Primary section when threats are made to cause fear or compel action
exceptions: Does not apply to vague or non-specific expressions of displeasure

conditions: Definition section establishing what constitutes criminal intimidation
exceptions: Must establish intent to cause alarm or compel illegal action

conditions: When threats are made anonymously by concealing identity
exceptions: Applies additionally when identity concealment element is present

conditions: When threats target woman's modesty through words gestures or objects
exceptions: Specific to threats targeting women's dignity or modesty

conditions: Primary section of NI Act for dishonoured cheques due to insufficient funds
exceptions: Requires legally enforceable debt and prior demand through legal notice

conditions: When cheque was issued with fraudulent intent knowing it would bounce
exceptions: Requires proof of dishonest intent at time of issuing cheque

conditions: When bigamy is alleged in matrimonial cases
exceptions: Applies only when prior marriage is legally subsisting at time of second marriage

conditions: When marriage was entered into through fraud or deceit
exceptions: Applicable when consent was obtained by deception

conditions: When matrimonial dispute involves cruelty by husband or relatives
exceptions: Most commonly invoked section in matrimonial disputes by wife

conditions: When matrimonial dispute involves suspected dowry death
exceptions: Only when death is unnatural and connected to dowry demands

conditions: When partner in adultery relationship was married; bigamy angle
exceptions: Second marriage must be shown to establish this section

conditions: Historical section on adultery; struck down by SC in 2018
exceptions: Cannot be invoked for criminal prosecution post September 2018

conditions: Base theft section applicable to all snatching cases
exceptions: Does not apply when force element elevates it to robbery

conditions: Specific section for snatching with or without causing hurt
exceptions: Primary section for phone snatching chain snatching cases

conditions: Enhanced punishment when snatching causes hurt to victim
exceptions: Applies when injury occurs during snatching

conditions: Robbery section when snatching involves threat or actual hurt
exceptions: Applies when force or threat of force is used to snatch

conditions: Definition section establishing when act amounts to murder
exceptions: Multiple exceptions under Section 300 can reduce murder to culpable homicide

conditions: Primary punishment section always charged in murder cases
exceptions: Applies when all ingredients of Section 300 are made out

conditions: Common intention section applied when murder committed by group
exceptions: Requires prior meeting of minds between accused persons

conditions: When murder is result of criminal conspiracy
exceptions: Conspiracy must be independently proved beyond murder itself

conditions: Primary section for attempt to murder when death does not result
exceptions: Requires act done with intent or knowledge to cause death

conditions: Attempt to commit culpable homicide not amounting to murder
exceptions: Applied when intent falls below murder threshold

conditions: When attempt to murder involves acid or corrosive substance
exceptions: Specific to acid attack attempt cases

conditions: Definition section establishing when act constitutes forgery
exceptions: Intent to cause damage or fraud is essential ingredient

conditions: Establishes what constitutes making a false document
exceptions: Important for establishing the actus reus of forgery

conditions: Primary punishment section always charged in forgery cases
exceptions: Always charged alongside definition sections

conditions: For forgery of valuable security will or deed
exceptions: Higher punishment for serious documents like property deeds wills

conditions: When forgery was specifically for purpose of cheating
exceptions: Cheating element must be specifically proved

conditions: When forged document was actually used as genuine
exceptions: Use of the document must be specifically proved

conditions: When court records or public registers are forged
exceptions: Specific to official and government documents

conditions: When false statement made on oath in judicial proceedings
exceptions: Oath must have been administered by competent authority

conditions: When fake evidence or records are fabricated
exceptions: Fabrication must be proved; mere suspicion insufficient

conditions: Punishment section paired with 191/192
exceptions: Always charged with substantive offence sections

conditions: Defines unlawful assembly which is prerequisite for rioting
exceptions: Minimum 5 persons must have common unlawful object

conditions: Defines rioting by use of force or violence by unlawful assembly
exceptions: Force or violence must actually be used not merely threatened

conditions: Primary punishment section for rioting charged in all riot cases
exceptions: Always charged with definition sections

conditions: Rioting armed with deadly weapons; enhanced punishment
exceptions: Weapon must actually be carried at time of rioting

conditions: Every member liable for common object of unlawful assembly
exceptions: Must prove accused was member of unlawful assembly

conditions: IT Act section for hacking and unauthorised access to computer systems
exceptions: Requires proving unauthorised access to computer resource

conditions: Identity theft using computer; using another person's electronic signature
exceptions: Specific to electronic identity theft scenarios

conditions: Cheating by personation through computer resource
exceptions: Applies to online impersonation and digital fraud

conditions: When online fraud results in financial loss to victim
exceptions: Requires proving cheating and dishonest inducement online

conditions: When cyber crime involves creation of fake digital documents
exceptions: Digital documents covered under IT Act amendment to forgery

conditions: When inheritance dispute involves bribery to influence succession decisions
exceptions: Rarely applicable; only when bribery specifically present

conditions: When inheritance dispute involves forged will or succession documents
exceptions: Forgery of will is specific ground to challenge succession

conditions: When legal heir is cheated out of inheritance through fraud
exceptions: Requires proving deliberate deception of legal heir

conditions: When loan amount was entrusted and misappropriated criminally
exceptions: Civil loan defaults without criminal element do not attract this

conditions: When loan was obtained fraudulently with no intention to repay
exceptions: Fraudulent intent at time of borrowing must be proved

conditions: When cheques given as security for loan bounce on presentation
exceptions: Requires valid debt and formal notice procedure

conditions: When seller makes threats to consumer demanding payment
exceptions: Rarely applicable in consumer disputes

conditions: When consumer was cheated by false promises about product or service
exceptions: Criminal element of deliberate fraud must be established
